qas.question: Where is the GDP of Thuringia?

answers.text: The accession of several new countries, the crisis in southern Europe and the sustained economic growth

qas.question: What has helped to sabotage Thuringia?
When will government subsidies to Thuringia renew?

context: The GDP of Thuringia is <a0_0><b4_0>below the national average<b4_0/><a0_0/>, in line with the other former East German Lands. <a1_0><b5_0>Until 2004<b5_0/><a1_0/>, Thuringia was one of the weakest regions within the European Union. <a2_0><b6_0>The accession of several new countries, the crisis in southern Europe and the sustained economic growth<b6_0/><a2_0/> in Germany since 2005 has brought the Thuringian GDP close to the EU average since then. The high economic subsidies granted by the federal government and the EU after 1990 are being reduced gradually and will end <a3_0><b7_0>around 2020<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
